concise_definition: n. 原文, 记录, 成绩单

definitions.explanation_en: A written or printed version of something that was originally spoken, such as a speech, interview, or conversation, preserving the exact words used.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指将原本口头表达的内容（如演讲、访谈或对话）逐字记录下来的书面或印刷版本，完整保留原始用语。
definitions.example_en: The journalist published a full transcript of the president's press conference.
definitions.example_cn: 记者发布了总统新闻发布会的完整文字记录。

definitions.explanation_en: An official record of a student's academic performance, listing all courses taken and grades received during a period of study.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指学生在学习期间所修课程及相应成绩的正式记录，通常由教育机构出具。
definitions.example_en: She submitted her official transcript to the university as part of her application.
definitions.example_cn: 她将官方成绩单作为申请材料提交给了大学。

definitions.explanation_en: A copy of a legal, medical, or technical document that has been transcribed from an original source, often for archival or verification purposes.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指从原始来源转录而来的法律、医疗或技术文件的副本，常用于存档或核实用途。
definitions.example_en: The court requested a transcript of the deposition taken last week.
definitions.example_cn: 法院要求提供上周所作证词的转录文本。

comparison.analysis: “Record”（记录）是一个更宽泛的术语，泛指任何形式的信息保存，包括音频、视频、数据或书面文件。而 “transcript” 特指将口头内容转化为书面文字的产物，强调“转录”这一行为。
“Script”（剧本/文稿）通常指事先写好的、用于表演或播报的文本，是原创的、计划中的内容。而 “transcript” 是对已发生口头交流的被动记录，非预先撰写。
“Summary”（摘要）是对原始内容的概括和提炼，省略细节，突出要点。而 “transcript” 必须完整保留原始语言，不允许删减或改写，其价值在于精确性和完整性。
